attributes.action: Throw out plans requiring voters to produce ID at polling stations
attributes.background: The UK government has announced plans to trial asking voters to produce ID before being allowed to vote. If this law was to be passed then it will be unfairly affecting the poor, the marginalised, the homeless, the isolated and the most vulnerable sections of our society. It needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: It is time to increase the strength of our Great Armed Forces by at least 10%
attributes.background: The reason for this is obvious in my view! The world is entering a very dangerous period.. With North Korea and Iran now playing dangerous games, and Islamic terrorism on the rise! The world is getting more dangerous, we can not keep reducing the size of our fighting capacity, we must increase it.
attributes.additional_details:
We weakened our armed forces just  prior to world war one and world war two, and reduced our Armed forces in the Falklands just before the Argentinians invaded! Weakening our Forces only encourages our Enemies, and Causes wars which are prolonged because we have to rebuild our assets.. We must learn from the lessons of history, and be in a strong position to deter our enemies..

It's no good saying we have enough to respond to today's issues! For example we could not re take the Falklands today.

attributes.action: All NHS Ambulance, Police & Fire vehicles and uniforms to display the Union flag
attributes.background: After the events in London this week we are reminded that our emergency services play a vital role in the frontline of combating and responding to national crisis. Like our armed forces they should wear with pride the union standard (Union Jack) flag as a symbol of pride and unity.

attributes.action: In the next Scottish independence referendum Scots ex-pats must be given a vote.
attributes.background: Many people that were born in Scotland now live abroad but still have a heavily vested interest in the future of Scotland. They may own property, run businesses and employ people here. Many will intend to return to Scotland. To deny them a vote in Scotland's future would be unfair and undemocratic.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister determines whether or not a second referendum will take place. In the event that she decides that it should, we petition her to make it a condition of the referendum that ex-patriot Scots who were born in Scotland should be allowed a vote.

attributes.action: Allow all high risk cancer patients to have annual check up scans nationwide.
attributes.background:
I would like patients at high risk of their cancer returning or at high risk of being diagnosed with metastatic cancer to have life saving annual check ups no matter where they live. 
At the moment this is a postcode lottery. 
Please sign my petition. 
It may save your life or a loved ones life.
attributes.additional_details:
My Name is Stacey. At the age of 26 I was given just weeks to live due to an aggressive form of ovarian cancer. I have two young children and I married my husband from my hospital bed.
After pioneering last resort radical surgery by Christina Fotopoulo my life was saved.
Despite the cancer being very likely to return and unlikely to be caught in time without regular scans I was horrified to discover that the NHS do not offer check up scans to all high risk patients like me. 
Help save a life.

attributes.action: Demand for animals play toys to pass a safety check
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: Fathers to receive the same full paternity pay just the same as mothers.
attributes.background: Currently the government say fathers should only be entitled to 2 weeks paternity leave and Â£139.58 per week or 90% of weekly average earnings. Whichever is LOWER! Why can't fathers have the same rights to receive full pay like mothers!

attributes.action: Bring back 30mph NATIONAL SPEED LIMIT (20mph is not practical on main roads)
attributes.background: Since setting of speed limits was relaxed, local councils have set inappropriate limits on main roads (sometimes across entire boroughs) without proper consultation (typically 20% or less of residents) and not used "LOCAL KNOWLEDGE" as suggested in Gov guidance. 20 is NOT PLENTY (in most cases)
attributes.additional_details:
With a 30 mph national limit, motorists knew where they stood legally

Southwark council consulted less than 400 people in their scheme to make the entire borough a 20mph zone (over 200,000 voters live in Southwark.

Islington cannot provide data to show the 20 mph borough has improved safety or reduced accidents

Most councils will use these artificially low limits as a revenue raiser, Traffic speed is slow enough in London without a 24hour 20mph limit being imposed unnecessarily.

attributes.action: Stop UK residents driving on foreign licences
attributes.background: The UK driving test is in place to ensure EVERY driver is safe to use our roads. But due to legislation EU/foreign drivers are able to drive for set periods/70years old on their countries licence. We MUST improve road safety, by ensuring EVERY driver living in UK undergoes OUR test.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2011 alone 80k licences were exchanged that's 80k people who have NEVER taken the UK test.
DVSA have clamped down on fraudulent tests, claiming 'the driving test is there to ensure all drivers have the skills & knowledge to use the roads safely & responsibly' 
This must be extended to truly ensure ALL drivers have this knowledge.

attributes.action: Increase verification to decrease the fraud in scrapping a stolen vehicle.
attributes.background:
Vehicles presented for scrapping by a thief can currently disappear if no V5 is presented on arrival at the scrapyard.
There is no electronic information or cross checking link between DVLA and police forces in the UK.
Remove the facility of cashing the cheque to the thief by the scrapyard.
attributes.additional_details: This follows an incident with a rare vehicle which after being stolen, disappeared, was effectively crushed, and all that happened before any checks could be made.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS wasting more time in the courts: Commission PrEP immediately.
attributes.background: PrEP stands for Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis. It's a course of HIV drugs for HIV negative people to take before sex to reduce their risk of contracting HIV. Research demonstrates that PrEP is as effective as condoms in preventing HIV transmission.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2016 NHS England stated that they were 'not responsible for commissioning PrEPâ. Following a legal challenge from the National AIDS Trust, which the NHS wasted time and money appealing, the Court of Appeal has ruled that the NHS has the legal power to fund PrEP. 

The NHSâs decision has already been delayed for over 6 months, so we urgently call on Jeremy Hunt to make PrEP available on the NHS. 

Every day the NHS delays its decision, 17 more people will be diagnosed with HIV.

attributes.action: Make Not Paying Taxi Fare a Crimnal Offence Oppose to a Civil Matter
attributes.background: When a passenger doesnt pay for a taxi ride either refusing or just simply run away and you call the Police, their response is its a civil matter not a criminal offence. Why is it not a criminal offence. The customer has not paid for a service provided by the taxi driver.

attributes.action: Referendum for Universal Basic Income, paid monthly for UK working age citizens.
attributes.background: It is an income paid to individuals, as a right of legal residence, without means testing or requirements to work. The payment is non taxable and should be sufficient to cover basic needs. This would provide a secure floor for people to build on, rather than a means tested benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
All sourced from this website:

http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for restaurants to clearly label vegan options.
attributes.background: It's commonplace for vegetarian options in restaurants to be clearly labelled, but can be rather difficult to determine which options are vegan, and can lead to lengthy research and awkward conversations. I feel it's necessary as vegetarians can eat all vegan food but not vice-versa.

attributes.action: Make mental health medication free on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health issues are a chronic illness that are not covered under medical exemption forms. It is often the case that people with mental health issues have long periods of no work therefore, no income to cover for the cost of medical prescriptions.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental health issues often require ongoing prescriptions to help manage symptoms & enable individuals to function in day-to-day life - to get & keep jobs, study, & properly care for themselves. Often individuals need to try many different drugs before finding one that works, & need to continuously take the drug for months or years. This is very expensive for those that may already be struggling with money due to their mental health.
Not being able to afford your medication sets you recover back.

attributes.action: More NHS funding in mental health for armed forces veterans suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: Many armed forces veterans are faced with harrowing and distressing circumstances in the line of duty.Organisations such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling to Lancashire armed forces Veterans and are not funded appropriately.Veterans need our support.
attributes.additional_details: Services such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling for armed forces veterans.In order to survive they need to be funded appropriately.This year they were given Â£20,000 less than the previous year and yet have a greater demand and an expanding waiting list.The demand for these services is high and the funding is lacking.Support our brave soldiers in the aftercare they deserve.

attributes.action: Keep the term "Honour Killing".
attributes.background:
Campaigners fought long and hard to get the term honour crimes recognised as a different form of abuse experienced by women within minority communities. 

Honour killings are different to domestic homicide, in the same way as domestic homicides are different to murder.
attributes.additional_details:
By likening honour killings to murder shows a clear lack of understanding of the complexities experienced by women from minority communities. 

Honour killings are different to domestic homicide, in the same way as domestic homicides are different to murder. 

This term honour killings acknowledges the complexities involved in these cases and the additional difficulties faced by the women experiencing these crimes. 

An example of this was the murder on Banaz Mahmod, where an entire community was silent following her murder, this is not the case in other cases of murder.

attributes.action: Condemn Donald Trump's ban on Muslim refugees and immigrants.
attributes.background: Donald Trump has signed an executive order to close Americaâs borders to Muslim refugees and immigrants from Iraq, Syria, Iran, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia.This is even being applied to green card residents. We must use our influence to condemn this deeply divisive move.

attributes.action: Legally define a single agreed definition for âvegetarianâ or âveganâ.
attributes.background: Currently there is no single agreed definition for âvegetarianâ or âveganâ. This makes it difficult to legally require food businesses to provide information on the suitability of their products for vegetarian and vegan consumers.
attributes.additional_details: A previous petition was raised to make labeling food as vegetarian and/or vegan as a legal requirement, as many companies refuse to label their products as Vegetarian or vegan. A simple legal requirement for a label, would assist thousands of consumers to make smart choices.  The government's response confirmed that no single agreed definition makes it difficult to legally require food businesses to provide labeling.  A legal definition will assist in changing this.

attributes.action: A better awareness of endometriosis within NHS and treatments available.
attributes.background: It can take years to diagnose condition, lack of understanding and knowledge within communities, more information and support available for sufferers, it may not be cancer but this is a slow crippling disease affecting your body and mind.

attributes.action: Keep RAF Halton open
attributes.background: The MOD are considering fully shutting down RAF Halton by 2022. Although this is in line with the ''Better Defence Estate' Strategy, which aims to contribute to the government's housing target, this site contains some on the UK's best RAF memorabilia and it would be a a shame to see this place gone.
attributes.additional_details: http://forces.tv/48967067

attributes.action: Allow Foster Carers to Transfer without being subject to another lengthy process
attributes.background: I have been a Foster Carer for my local authority for the past five years. Over the last year I have become incredibly unhappy with the way in which the service has treated myself and other carers. We are unable to transfer to another agency without being subject to another full process.
attributes.additional_details: I have taken the time to speak to carers, some of whom have dedicated their whole lives to fostering. Many have shared with me that despite being unhappy they remain where they are as they could not face another full process at their time of life. They also feel that they are unable to share how they are feeling due to fear of being penalised by the local authority for example 'not placing children with them'. As carers we have no rights, please give us the right to transfer and be happy!

attributes.action: Stop the decline in high streets by ensuring equity in businesses.
attributes.background: High streets in small towns in Britain are in decline. This is seen in the unoccupied premises and in the plethora of charity shops. While charity is important so is the diversity of the high street. Online business is also impacting on the high street.
attributes.additional_details: In many towns high rent and rates have sent many small businesses to the wall to be replaced by charity shops contributing little to the local economy getting free stock, using volunteer workers, getting breaks on rates etc. Coupled with the growth in online sales this means that it is harder for small businesses to compete. Giving new business the same breaks given to charity shops and ensuring online and retail business are treated the same way in terms of tax etc. would help small business.

attributes.action: Provide fathers upto 6 weeks paternity leave, including upto 4 weeks full pay
attributes.background: During a time when the mother and newborn need the father around most, we seem to think its okay to dramatically  reduce a fathers pay and to send him back to full time work just 2 weeks after the baby is born - often when the mother has not fully recovered! A newborn needs both parents around!
attributes.additional_details:
Sweden gives fathers upto 12 weeks paternity leave with 80% of fathers full pay for the entire time.

Norway gives fathers 2 weeks paternity on full pay plus upto an additional 14 weeks on 80%-100% of their pay.

We are behind a lot of developed countries when it comes to fathers rights and fully paid paternity leave.

attributes.action: Ehler Danlos Syndrome NEEDS doctors knowledge! FUND IT!
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos Syndrome has different types, the common link between them is Pain. Most people affected by this illness aren't diagnosed until later on in their lives.It is mostly an invisible illness and can ruin your life completely. THERE IS NO CURE! Most doctors don't know what it is.#makeachange
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from ehler danlos syndrome and life is hard at the best of times, when something goes wrong you would think a doctor to know at least a bit of background about it. NOT EDS! This is horrifying as so many people go undiagnosed and refused the help they need to manage it! Not all of us with EDS can make it to America for treatment so we need something set up to help people in the ð¬ð§. Every time a doctor says "i don't know what that is" it saddens me. Please help to change thisð

attributes.action: Give the CQC powers to regulate & inspect all Care recruitment agencies
attributes.background: Recruitment in care is becoming a huge issue, every provider now has a problem with agency use. There are enough staff out there but they are working for agencies rather than the regulated Care Homes and Hospitals. It is not a level playing field and staff are drawn to agencies that break the rules.
attributes.additional_details: Agencies don't have to register with the CQC if where they work is already registered. Staff are drawn to agency work as they employ immediately, often without DBS checks & let them work excessive hours in different homes. If we challenge them then they are just moved to another home. We as managers have to use them to fill gaps in our staffing but we wouldn't need to if they played by the same rules and staff were not drawn to quick unregulated employment. Charles G Sadler - Registered Manager

attributes.action: Tell us how & when you will have us living within our means to avoid bankruptcy.
attributes.background: We are facing bankruptcy because Gov overspent Tax Revenue Â£534 ml every single day during 2005-15 (Â£624 ml 15-16) but we are allowing thousands of immigrants into our Country each week all of whom want at our expense somewhere to live, healthcare, education for their children and money to live on.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of Healthcare, Education and Welfare equates to Â£99 per week for every living person so a family of 4 immigrants (including a home) costs us in the region of Â£600 per week for a man to do a job that others will not do whilst at the same time we pay capable men large sums of money to stay at home and do nothing. Is it surprising we are facing bankruptcy? Please see my website www.mrms.uk for many more alarming facts about the way Government is running our Country.

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Attempted murder for those who have stamped on a victim's head during an assault
attributes.background:
There is a culture of violence that is growing in today's society whereby stamping on someone's head is perfectly normal during an assault. 

This is literally trying to kill. Anyone who claims they don't think it is life threatening is a liar. 

Those who do it, do it often
attributes.additional_details:
I am seeing more and more cases of people being seriously injured, disfigured, left with brain damage and killed because of this accepted culture of violence.

Such attacks are clearly life threatening. I myself have had my skull broken in half from such an attack but was lucky enough to not have any visible damage.

Those who have been proven to stamp on a victim's head should be subjected to a mandatory attempted murder charge. This is the only way to stop it before it gets any worse.

attributes.action: Cover mental health under The Equality Act 2010
attributes.background: The Equality Act covers the same groups that were protected by existing equality legislation â age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership and pregnancy and maternity. These are now called âprotected characteristicsâ.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 people in the UK will experience a mental health problem each year. Just because you cannot see a disability, which it is, doesn't mean it does not exist and should not be under the Equality Act 2010. They say it "can" be covered if there is proof it effects day to day life, but that is unacceptable as it can be hard to prove that. People all over the country suffer. Jobs, benefits, health all put strain on people where they cannot cope, mental health should be a protected characteristic.

attributes.action: People who work in ALL places of Worship must be DBS and OFSTED checked
attributes.background: I was abused by the Imam at the mosque I attended in the 1980s. I went to court, attended trials and finally got the guilty verdict.  He was sentenced to 11 and half years but absconded the next day. Iâm waiting for him to be extradited back. I wrote a book in 2012 about my story, called âBrutalâ.
attributes.additional_details:
Brutal By Nabila Sharma 2012
Hafiz Rahman sentenced to 11 and half years at Wolverhampton Crown Court October 2016.

attributes.action: Support workers/health care assistants to be paid a min of Â£10 per hour.
attributes.background: I work as a senior support worker on a dementia unit.  My responsibilities are vast in safeguarding vulnerable people. Most support staff working in the care sector will tell you how demanding the job role is. A true reflection of hourly pay is needed for what our job role involves.

attributes.action: Increase income tax by 1% and use it to boost NHS funding only.
attributes.background: We are aware that the NHS is facing difficult times.We are fortunate that is has fantastic infrastructure employing a wealth of skilled workers. The NHS directly benefits all of us. Even those with private health insurance employ staff relying on the NHS. We will all benefit from a strong NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
When we or our loved ones are sick, we need the support of the health service and we value the skill and commitment of staff. Nobody likes to wait for hours for appointments, test results or operations, but the service is under strain. The range of treatments is vast and the population is growing.
Every penny each of us puts into the NHS is a way of looking after ourselves and those we love.
Let's have an NHS to feel proud of. I am happy to have two less Starbucks a week to make this happen.

attributes.action: Make all take-away and fast food outlets use compostable containers and cutlery.
attributes.background: I was inspired by the same ethos used at Glastonbury festival where all cutlery is wooden and the containers are made from expanded or blown cardboard, even when serving gravy. It will aid the recycling of food waste. We need to reduce the volume of plastics going to landfill.

attributes.action: Force Google and other search engines to block illegal internet pharmacies
attributes.background:
Millions of pounds of counterfeit and unlicensed medicines are sold in the UK.  Internet pharmacies must be registered with MHRA and display an internet pharmacy logo.
Demand the government stops Google & Bing from displaying illegal pharmacy websites which are not registered with the MHRA.
attributes.additional_details:
Falsified medicines are a major threat to public health and safety. 

Currently the MHRA contact internet service providers to block websites. This takes months and doesn't work. Stopping Google displaying these websites is far more effective, faster and easier way to reduce the number of citizens using these illegal sites.

Study from the Uni. of Oxford found 75% of online pharmacies selling anti-biotics are illegal: https://goo.gl/0DoYct

MHRA EU Common Logo Scheme: https://goo.gl/5gpeOA

attributes.action: We request the government ban the sale of cotton style rodent bedding in shops.
attributes.background:
Cotton style (Cotton, wool, vegetable fibres) nesting material is harmful to pets yet is still sold in a number of shops nationwide. See Additional details for further information. 
I lost two hamsters to the bedding and after discovering it had happened to hundreds more, I started this campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
View http://www.hamsteradvice.com/ban-fluffy-bedding.html for information on how the bedding affects animals. It details how it causes harm internally, by causing blockages in the stomach and also wrapping round limbs which results in potential self-amputation.

The material needs to be banned from pet shops, it has claimed the lives of thousands of pets and continues to do so with the lack of awareness on the dangers.

attributes.action: Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU; keeping UK in EU.
attributes.background:
Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU so Leavers can Leave EU. Keep post-Partition UK a full EU member state (do not activate Art.50) so Remainers can Remain in EU.
Precedents: Isle of Man, Jersey & Guernsey are BCDs outside EU.
When Greenland left Denmark, Denmark stayed EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full Petition Text & Detailed List of the 7 new BCDs' areas (with % Leave vote figures): http://tinyurl.com/ntg88ta
Maps of 7 BCDs: 
http://tinyurl.com/orygvny 
http://tinyurl.com/ogb3qnk
Further:
UK Govt to assign finance & civil servants to help each of new BCDs get its Govt / Parliament set up.
Defence still by UK; major roads, rail, power grids & nuclear reactors stay UK territory; later on BCDs contribute finances. 
Reciprocal NHS Arrangement between BCDs & UK (like Isle of Man & UK now).

attributes.action: Child Maintenance payments should be audited to ensure they are used on child.
attributes.background: CSA/CMS do not audit payments to ensure the child receives directly or indirectly the benefit of the payment. This is a petition to ensure that at the payees expense these payments are audited as often as the payee requires. No cost to HMG, only the payee. This is internationally applicable.

attributes.action: Stop landlords and property agencies to say no to dss tenants or ask guarantor
attributes.background: Asylums who they will come to the UK after they become a refugee they will face a big fight for them life and the first question is where they have to live some of them they can provide deposit for private renting but there is more problem because most of properties DSS not accept or need guarantor
attributes.additional_details: People who they coming to the UK as Universal Declaration of Human Rights article 13 exactly said they can choose where to live and they most have equality same as other people , so they can choose where to live and they can provide deposit and rent but there is something not equal and that is the local connection for bidding a house or chance to rent private because of problem with no DSS accepted properties or asking for a guarantor when thay don't know anyone in new country PLEASE STOP NO DSS

attributes.action: Cap the limit on private hire vehicles plated in the UK
attributes.background: Far too many private hire vehicles on the road in the UK It has stop people making a living wage and now a danger to the public as drivers have to work over 90 hours a wage to able to pay the overheads and feed there familys to many drivers have no idea where there go or know how to drive safely
attributes.additional_details: Since most council have do away with a test for drivers to see if they know the area they are to work in and have let cross boarder hiring it has put the public in danger as driver who cant read or speak english and dont know the road signs or highway code and donot get the correct dbr checks has made this pratices unfare to drivers who have done all the things set out before the tests were done away with and are now struggling to make a living

attributes.action: All Parkinson's Disease patients entitlement to a Medical Exemption Certificate
attributes.background:
People with life-long conditions such as e.g. Epilepsy, Diabetes, are entitled to a Medical Exemption Certificate. 
A Medical Exemption Certificate entitles people to free NHS Prescriptions, Dental care etc. 
I believe Parkinson's Disease should be acknowledged as one of these conditions.

attributes.action: Review effectiveness of the law in protecting consumers from breach of contract
attributes.background: It's illegal to breach a contract but in reality it's very difficult for a consumer to recover their money. The Government needs to investigate how the current law is working and improve protections for consumers.
attributes.additional_details: Both wheelchair users we paid Â£27,500 for a downstairs disabled toilet & lounge extension. Despite agreeing the contract last April and paying the total in three payments, less than half the contracted work has been done.  We've been informed that itâs unlikely we can get our money back, even using the courts. The Government must investigate how the laws are failing to protect people like us and take action to make them more effective so others donât have to go through what we have.

attributes.action: Build Homes for our Heroes. Armed forces personnel deserve support from the UK.
attributes.background: Our Armed Forces are heroes.  We believe that the Government should build homes for them to help them integrate back into society and in order to adapt to civilian life.

attributes.action: Make "critical thinking" a mandatory subject in secondary school.
attributes.background: Critical thinking skills will allow the UK populous to improve their decision making process. Making critical thinking mandatory in schools will lead to future generations being better equipped to question what they are told in terms of facts and feasibility.
attributes.additional_details: The National Council for Excellence in Critical Thinking defines critical thinking as the "intellectually disciplined process of actively and skillfully conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, synthesizing, and/or evaluating information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action."

attributes.action: Make Public Transport Strike Action Illegal - Put in Alternative Dispute Process
attributes.background: The Southern Trains series of strikes has left the paying commuter helpless with no resolution in sight. The status quo is not working and it is unfair for the public to suffer and be a pawn in these disputes. Strike action should be illegal and an alternative dispute method sought.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-38296623

attributes.action: Merge PSV license with Category C license
attributes.background: coach drivers carry human lives and drive upto 50ft vehicles but cant drive a 32 tonne lorry which is a smaller vehicle. if this was passed i think it would open up more job opportunities and give both industries qualified professional drivers

attributes.action: Make Health Tourists pay for their treatment
attributes.background: We believe that people who are not from the UK and use the NHS for treatment should be made to pay. Health Tourism costs the NHS between Â£200m and Â£2bn. It is time the Government acted and stopped the chronic abuse of health tourists using the NHS for free and made them pay their way.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for cinemas to provide access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.background:
1 in 6 people in the UK have some form of hearing loss or deafness, this accounts for 11 million people, with over 900,000 having a severe or profound deafness. 

Fewer than 1% of cinema screening are currently subtitled, we would like to see an increase in access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details:
On January 17th 2017, it becomes mandatory for all cinemas showing digital films within the United States of America to provide closed-caption personal subtitling devices at every showing. This means that open screen subtitling, which is infrequently programmed, isn't the only option for patrons with hearing loss. 

We believe that the UK should follow suit and provide proper access to those with hearing loss that wish to access the cinema.

attributes.action: Re-apply for Membership of the European Union once we Leave by 2020.
attributes.background: The European Union is a cherished community of Nations which allows each individual state to develop and prosper in its own way. The UK's decision to leave the EU was disastrous, causing our nation to become more divided than ever. Sign this petition to aid the government in realising our mistake.
attributes.additional_details: Since the referendum result, thousands of 'Leave' voters have realised their own mistake, prompting them to regret their personal decision. The European Union provides reliable allies who essentially produce security and stability. Leaving the European Union means that we will also HAVE to withdraw from the Single Market. This has resulted in a vast amount of jobs being created, leading to growth and prosperity. The European Union is incredibly unique. Don't waste this opportunity.

attributes.action: Enable U.K. roaming
attributes.background: Not all mobile telephone networks cover all areas of the UK. Roaming would allow all subscribers to use all networks
attributes.additional_details: The National Infrastructure Report last year high-lighted significant deficiencies in existing networks' coverage
